Question: Navigation Instruction given at initial position: [take off and turn back and move forward and go over the buildings and pond and get down at beside the tree and again turn back and fly up. now move forward and go over the trees and road and turn back at top of the brown building and get down at front of the this building. now get down and fly up and turn right and little move forward and turn left and move forward and turn left and move forward and turn back and fly up and beside the blue building and move forward and go over the top of the buildings and turn right and and fly up at front of the brown building. now turn right and again turn right and beside pond and move forward and go over the road and tip of the buildings and turn right and get up and move forward and stay at front of the building.]. At the initial position, you are asked to navigate according to a series of movement instructions. In terms of next steps, what is your best next step?  
choose:  
A. I go up and turn right.  
B. I descend and then fly forward.  
C. I fly forward when rising.  
D. I turn left and descend.  
E. I rotate the camera downward.

textgrad_result.init_answer: Option: C; Reason: The initial instruction is to "take off and turn back and move forward," which implies the first action should be to ascend (fly up) and then proceed with other movements. Among the given options, "I fly forward when rising" aligns best with this initial step of taking off and moving forward.
